alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 8:36PM CDT until September 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN COTTON...NORTHWESTERN CLAY...NORTHEASTERN ARCHER AND WICHITA COUNTIES... At 836 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Temple to near Holliday, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Iowa Park, Holliday, Dean, Randlett, Sheppard AFB, Mankins, Lakeside City, Pleasant Valley, Taylor, Charlie, and Cashion. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
